title: traverse arr1 and minArray - fix error

content.description:
In the following code segment,  arr1  and  minArray  are properly declared and initialized  int  arrays of equal length. During the traversal of the array, each element of  arr1  is compared to the corresponding element of  minArray  located at the same index. If any element of  arr1  is smaller than the corresponding element of  minArray,  the code segment is intended to replace that element of  minArray  with the corresponding element of  arr1.  After the code segment is executed,  arr1  should remain unchanged and  minArray  should hold the lesser of the two elements originally found at corresponding indices in  arr1  and  minArray.

The code segment does not work as intended.
 for (int c = 0; c < arr1.length; c++) // Line 1
{ // Line 2
   if (arr1[c] < minArray[c]) // Line 3
 { // Line 4
 arr1[c] = minArray[c]; // Line 5
 } // Line 6
 else // Line 7
 { // Line 8
 minArray[c] = arr1[c]; // Line 9
 } // Line 10
} // Line 11
content.question: Which of the following changes can be made so that the code segment works as intended?

choices.label: Changing the relational operator in line 3 to  >
Swapping the positions of line 5 and line 9

skill.text: 3.D: Explain why a code segment will not compile or work as intended and modify the code to correct the error.
